articles.title: What sea level rise will do to famous American sites, visualized - The Guardian
articles.description: New images show what areas of the world can be saved or lost if carbon emissions aren’t curbed
articles.content:

articles.title: Hearth site in Utah desert reveals human tobacco use 12300 years ago - Reuters
articles.description: Scientists have unearthed evidence of a milestone in human culture - the earliest-known use of tobacco - in the remnants of a hearth built by early inhabitants of North America's interior about 12,300 years ago in Utah's Great Salt Lake Desert.
